nodes.text: Well, you see, I have a little side business that I need some help attending to. I have a moonshine still outside of town that needs to be fueled up every so often. Since a gecko done bit my leg, I can’t hobble out to it before it runs out of fuel. If I tell you where it is, would you refuel it for me? It’s worth $50 to me.

Well, Vic was quite a fella. He didn’t like to work too much, so he would specialize in expensive pre-war things and then go sell them to the Den -- or even hawk them to stupid tribals as religious artifacts (chuckles to himself). Oops, no offense. Anyhow, I haven’t seen him for a while. Last I heard, he went south to sell some stuff. Maybe to the Den.
Always nice to find another drinking buddy. Wanna buy me a drink? Talking always makes me  thirsty.

Well, out back of Trapper Town, just to the west of downtown, there’s a back section that’s overrun by rats. The further back you, go the bigger they get. Some say that there’s one huge great rat spirit that’s leading them all. Some of the trappers won’t even stay there anymore. They say it’s  too dangerous.
All sorts of things going on hereabouts lately. We’ve got brahmin mutilators,  walking spirits, gigantical rats, and missing people. Some even say the Den’s involved.

Somebody done smashed up my still! And you’re the only person I told about it. Why, if I were a younger feller, more full of piss and vinegar, I’d have a mind to teach you a lesson. Just get out of my sight, you double-crosser!
Finished fueling my still? Naw, I don’t reckon that you have yet. Well be sure and come back  when you have.
Nice try there, but $50 is all the job’s worth to me. Heck, I can’t afford to pay any more.

I sure wish you had kept your word to me. You didn’t get to my still in time and my latest batch of hootch is plum ruined! I don’t want to have anything more to do with you and I hope no one  else does, either.
Well, thanks for refueling my still for me. Here’s your $50, too. Got any questions that I can answer for you?
Bob doesn't seem to want to talk to you.
Looks as though you’re purse has run dry. You don’t have enough money to buy old Bob a drink.
My name’s . Nice to meet you Whiskey Bob.
They say that critters that look like giant man-shaped bugs, in a shell and everything, are mutilating brahmin at night. All they find are the torn open, horribly hacked up brahmin corpses.
Hey there, gal. Want to talk to Whiskey Bob again about drinks and business and such? I’ll let you sit on my lap! (heh, heh) Just kidding.
Sweetheart, you break my heart every time you open your mouth. Maybe some other time I can take you back to Trapper Town and I’ll show you my etchings (heh, heh). Bye, cutie.
Uh, (embarrassed) I kind of used that page to take care of some business, if you know what I  mean.

There’s a canyon just to the west of town that had a bright light in it a few months back. Ever since, every now and then, there’s been a horrible squealing sound that comes from the canyon. Brahmin that wander in don’t come back. Everyone’s afraid to get too near.

The real person to tell you about the missing trapper would be Mrs. Buckner. She and Smiley were pretty close. He went north to look for the cave of the golden geckos and hasn’t been seen since. That was a while back, too.
I’m . What’s happening here in town?
I don’t want to hear your damn excuses. Just get the heck out of my sight! But I’ll tell you one thing; everyone’s going to know just how worthless your word is before I’m through.
Thanks for helping me out with my still. I should be able to do it myself when my leg heals just a bit. Have any questions for an old bar-hound like myself?
Thanks for the drink, partner. Now that my whistle’s wet, I feel that I can share a little problem I have. Hey -- maybe you can help me out?
Lately, we’ve had a couple of people go missing. A trader, named Vic, who specialized in pre-war stuff, and one of our best trappers.
Howdy, what can I do for you?

A Garden of Eden Creation Kit? Why I think I saw one of those listed on a page of an old catalog I was looking through while I was sitting down, out back. But I don’t know much more about it  than that.
Humph, I think that I’d rather go to Sally’s bathhouse than spend time with you. Now git.
Now then, it’s not going to take you too long and it’s not too dangerous at all. Probably. You want to hear about it or not?
Fair enough. You’re a sharp one, there’s no denying it. Here’s some booze. Now in return, you get to listen to my little problem.

All you have to do is find a little shack just south of town. Go inside and dump some firewood into the still. Then come back here and I’ll give you your money. But it needs to be done within the next day, or my batch of hootch will go bad.
You’ll do it? Great. Remember, you gotta do it soon or my hootch will go bad. Thanks a heap.  See you back here soon.
Ain’t you a cute little thing. My name’s Bob, Whiskey Bob -- what’s yours?

A few people have seen the bugmen, but the one who’s got the best look was Torr, the Buckner’s boy. What he saw scared him half out of his wits, and the poor lad is a bit shy in that department  already.

Not ‘A den,’ - ‘The Den.’ You’ll not find a greater hive of scum and villainy. Now where did I hear that? In any case, it’s a rough sort of place a few days travel south of Klamath. Anything can be had there for a price...even slaves. But you have to be very careful there -— lots of short tempers attached to dangerous weapons. I don’t think they have much to do with us, though; we’re too poor here.

links.text: That doesn’t sound too bad -- tell me more.
What about the missing trapper?
Let me ask you about something else, Bob.
Sure, Bob. Don’t mind a bit.
With a nickname like yours, Whiskey Bob, maybe you should be providing the drinks.
I don’t want to buy you a drink, Whiskey Bob.
Trappers ousted by rats? Tell me about some of the other things.
Missing people? Tell me more.
Tell me all about the walking spirits.
Tell me about the brahmin mutilations.
I need to ask you about something else. Have you ever heard of something called a Garden of Eden  Creation Kit?
A den? What kind of den?
Gigantical rats? I’ve gotta hear more about those.
OK, I’ll do it.
But I, I thought I had more time….
Your hootch tastes like dogpiss anyway.
Yes. Tell me what’s going on in town lately.
That sounds horrible.
Sure, Bob - tell me about drinks and business.
Business? Oh, that kind of business. I prefer old newspaper, myself. Oh well, tell me something  else, then.
Yes, surely a sign of spirit infestation. If only you had a competent shaman. Tell me about  something else.
Hmm, intersting. Tell me about something else, though.
What about the missing trader?
Well, I have been wondering about some of the rumors I’ve heard around town.
Anything unusual going on in town lately?
If it won’t take too long, I guess I could help you. For a price, of course.
How can I help you out?
Tell me more about the trader some call…Vic?
I want to know more about the trapper.
Let me ask you about something else.
What is going on around here?
Nothing, thanks.
Really? I’d like to see that catalog.
I think I’ve heard enough. Goodbye.
OK, go ahead and tell me about it.
[MORE]
That sounds pretty easy. OK, I’ll do it.
$50 doesn’t sound like nearly enough for a job like that.
No problem, Bob. See you in a day.
Happy to help. But first, tell me what’s going on in town lately.
Incredible! Let me ask about something else.
I think I’d be safe enough there; I know how to handle myself. Let me ask you about something  else, though.
